detaileddescription.para:
head
The head to initialize.
name
The head name, e.g. the connector name or equivalent.
The head will be safe to attach, detach and release.
The name is used in logs, and can be used by compositors as a configuration identifier.

head
The head to be released.
Destroys the head. The caller is responsible for freeing the memory pointed to by head.

head
The head to modify.
connected
Whether the head is connected.
Connectors are created as disconnected. This function can be used to set the connector status.

The status should be set to true when a physical connector is connected to a video sink device like a monitor and to false when the connector is disconnected. For nested backends, the connection status should reflect the connection to the parent display server.
When the connection status changes, it schedules a call to the heads_changed hook and sets the device_changed flag.
This is used for embedded screens, like laptop panels.

head
The head to mark as internal.
By default a head is external. The type is often inferred from the physical connector type.

memberdef.argsstring: (struct weston_head *head, const char *make, const char *model, const char *serialno)
memberdef.name: weston_head_set_monitor_strings

briefdescription.para: Store monitor make, model and serial number.

detaileddescription.para:
head
The head to modify.
make
The monitor make. If EDID is available, the PNP ID. Otherwise any string, or NULL for none.
model
The monitor model or name, or a made-up string, or NULL for none.
serialno
The monitor serial number, a made-up string, or NULL for none.
This may set the device_changed flag.

parameterdescription.para: Whether the head connects to a non-desktop display.

detaileddescription.para:
head
The head to modify.
mm_width
Image area width in millimeters.
mm_height
Image area height in millimeters.
This may set the device_changed flag.

head
The head to modify.
sp
Sub-pixel layout. The possible values are:
WL_OUTPUT_SUBPIXEL_UNKNOWN,
WL_OUTPUT_SUBPIXEL_NONE,
WL_OUTPUT_SUBPIXEL_HORIZONTAL_RGB,
WL_OUTPUT_SUBPIXEL_HORIZONTAL_BGR,
WL_OUTPUT_SUBPIXEL_VERTICAL_RGB,
WL_OUTPUT_SUBPIXEL_VERTICAL_BGR
This may set the device_changed flag.

head
The head to modify.
transform
The transformation to apply for this head
This may set the device_changed flag.

briefdescription.para: Initializes a weston_output object with enough data so an output can be configured.

detaileddescription.para:
output
The weston_output object to initialize
compositor
The compositor instance.
name
Name for the output (the string is copied).
Sets initial values for fields that are expected to be configured either by compositors or backends.
The name is used in logs, and can be used by compositors as a configuration identifier.
Removes the output from the list of enabled outputs if necessary, but does not call the backend's output disable function. The output will no longer be in the list of pending outputs either.
All fields of weston_output become uninitialized, i.e. should not be used anymore. The caller can free the memory after this.

memberdef.argsstring: (struct weston_output *output, const struct timespec *stamp, uint32_t presented_flags)
memberdef.name: weston_output_finish_frame

memberdef.argsstring: (struct weston_output *output, double device_x, double device_y, double *x, double *y)
memberdef.name: weston_output_transform_coordinate

briefdescription.para: Transform device coordinates into global coordinates.

detaileddescription.para:
output
the weston_output object
device_x
X coordinate in device units.
device_y
Y coordinate in device units.
x
X coordinate in the global space.
y
Y coordinate in the global space.
Transforms coordinates from the device coordinate space (physical pixel units) to the global coordinate space (logical pixel units). This takes into account output transform and scale.

briefdescription.para: Transform a region in-place from global to output coordinates.

detaileddescription.para:
output
The output that defines the transformation.
region
The region to be transformed in-place.
This takes a region in the global coordinate system, and takes into account output position, transform and scale, and the zoom, and converts the region into output pixel coordinates in the framebuffer.
Uses floating-point operations if zoom is active, which may round to expand the region.

memberdef.name: notify_touch_normalized

briefdescription.para: Feed in touch down, motion, and up events, calibratable device.

detaileddescription.para: It assumes always the correct cycle sequence until it gets here: touch_down touch_update ... touch_update touch_end. The driver is responsible for sending along such order.

device
The physical device that generated the event.
time
The event timestamp.
touch_id
ID for the touch point of this event (multi-touch).
x
X coordinate in compositor global space.
y
Y coordinate in compositor global space.
norm
Normalized device X, Y coordinates in calibration space, or NULL.
touch_type
Either WL_TOUCH_DOWN, WL_TOUCH_UP, or WL_TOUCH_MOTION.
Coordinates double_x and double_y are used for normal operation.
Coordinates norm are only used for touch device calibration. If and only if the weston_touch_device does not support calibrating, norm must be NULL.

The calibration space is the normalized coordinate space [0.0, 1.0][0.0, 1.0] of the weston_touch_device. This is assumed to map to the similar normalized coordinate space of the associated weston_output.

memberdef.argsstring: (struct weston_touch_device *device, const struct timespec *time, int touch_id, double x, double y, int touch_type)
memberdef.name: notify_touch
